concept.title: Creating a Site Using the Site Setup Wizard
concept.abstract:
Sites allow System Admins and staff users to create websites that run natively on Force.com and link to Salesforce Communities. With Sites, Admins can extend the reach of existing applications to new, external audiences. Sites are a cornerstone of the Communities app and integral to successful portal deployment.
Sites have a "many-to-one" relationship with the Salesforce Community, and each community is permitted one default Site. All pertinent data is pulled from the Community into the Site object as soon as the two are linked. Do not include any special characters in the name of a Site.
Sites control the configurations for:
Group Settings
Social Logins
Pages
Branding
The Site record hosts the profile and account that are assigned to new users on the Login & Registration page in Setup.
Creating a New Site via the Site Setup Wizard:
Navigate to the Sites tab within the Communities app and click New to return the Site Setup Wizard.
Select the Community and click Next.
Choose the Template and click Next.
Enter the Site Name, and optionally, enter a Description. Click Next.
Click Submit.Ensure the assigned registered users profile is populated on the Community. Otherwise, the Site autopopulation will not occur.
Once the Site record is returned, refresh the page in order for the system to autopopulate the applicable fields. Admins have the added ability to overwrite custom Salesforce Community error pages, add navigation links, and link to events.
Customizing Site Configurations
Change the default theme using the Theme lookup.
Use the Store lookup to link to a Site in the Community Portal.
Check the Enable eStore checkbox to offer items in the Store for sale.
Check the Is Published checkbox. In the event the Community Portal will not offer items for sale in the Store, hide the Store tab by navigating to the Pages related list and clicking the Page Name for the Store. Uncheck the Is Published checkbox to remove the Store link and click Save. To make the Store visible only to authenticated portal users, check the Auth Required checkbox.
What to do Next:
Modify the Theme
System Admins can further enhance to their Site's usability by enabling social logins such as Google, LinkedIn, and Twitter.
Otherwise, Enable Community Portal Users.
